### lto&#95;diagnostic&#95;handler&#95;t {#gacc8bcb5e44e35ed3a8b8e9f077218c21}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>typedef void(&#42; lto&#95;diagnostic&#95;handler&#95;t) (lto&#95;codegen&#95;diagnostic&#95;severity&#95;t severity, const char &#42;diag, void &#42;ctxt)</>}>
Diagnostic handler type.

<code>severity</code> defines the severity. <code>diag</code> is the actual diagnostic. The diagnostic is not prefixed by any of severity keyword, e.g., &#39;error: &#39;. <code>ctxt</code> is used to pass the context set with the diagnostic handler.

### lto&#95;codegen&#95;add&#95;module() {#gaca40f093d4adbb3dcc24fe7f0056684d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>lto&#95;bool&#95;t lto&#95;codegen&#95;add&#95;module (<a href="#ga6e1ba6da4277057a20e147d9412a03d7">lto&#95;code&#95;gen&#95;t</a> cg, <a href="#ga3ce415fd9e8109d4835461c6de1b9d82">lto&#95;module&#95;t</a> mod)</>}>
Add an object module to the set of modules for which code will be generated.

Returns true on error (check <a href="#gae09912101ce40de1049e5bf6355f6137">lto&#95;get&#95;error&#95;message()</a> for details).

<code>cg</code> and <code>mod</code> must both be in the same context. See <em><a href="#ga0751ca93aa0745e38238d1907ef749a1">lto&#95;codegen&#95;create&#95;in&#95;local&#95;context()</a></em> and <em><a href="#ga05d6a2cd667124de281532624ea6ba8c">lto&#95;module&#95;create&#95;in&#95;codegen&#95;context()</a></em>.


<SectionUser title="Since">
prior to LTO&#95;API&#95;VERSION=3
</SectionUser>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/lto-h/#l00404">404</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/lto-h">lto.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### lto&#95;codegen&#95;add&#95;must&#95;preserve&#95;symbol() {#gac2b8b7c3f5322c232e269c93f4377d70}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void lto&#95;codegen&#95;add&#95;must&#95;preserve&#95;symbol (<a href="#ga6e1ba6da4277057a20e147d9412a03d7">lto&#95;code&#95;gen&#95;t</a> cg, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> char &#42; symbol)</>}>
Adds to a list of all global symbols that must exist in the final generated code.

If a function is not listed there, it might be inlined into every usage and optimized away.


<SectionUser title="Since">
prior to LTO&#95;API&#95;VERSION=3
</SectionUser>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/lto-h/#l00469">469</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/lto-h">lto.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### lto&#95;codegen&#95;compile() {#ga2046c9820e71ce99f76234359be8df73}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>const void &#42; lto&#95;codegen&#95;compile (<a href="#ga6e1ba6da4277057a20e147d9412a03d7">lto&#95;code&#95;gen&#95;t</a> cg, size&#95;t &#42; length)</>}>
Generates code for all added modules into one native object file.

This calls lto&#95;codegen&#95;optimize then lto&#95;codegen&#95;compile&#95;optimized.

On success returns a pointer to a generated mach-o/ELF buffer and length set to the buffer size. The buffer is owned by the <a href="#ga6e1ba6da4277057a20e147d9412a03d7">lto&#95;code&#95;gen&#95;t</a> and will be freed when <a href="#ga226045782babbda624255217e4934dae">lto&#95;codegen&#95;dispose()</a> is called, or <a href="#ga2046c9820e71ce99f76234359be8df73">lto&#95;codegen&#95;compile()</a> is called again. On failure, returns NULL (check <a href="#gae09912101ce40de1049e5bf6355f6137">lto&#95;get&#95;error&#95;message()</a> for details).


<SectionUser title="Since">
prior to LTO&#95;API&#95;VERSION=3
</SectionUser>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/lto-h/#l00494">494</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/lto-h">lto.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### lto&#95;codegen&#95;compile&#95;optimized() {#gad07286ee88f734bf57437c9c0f7d4c6a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>const void &#42; lto&#95;codegen&#95;compile&#95;optimized (<a href="#ga6e1ba6da4277057a20e147d9412a03d7">lto&#95;code&#95;gen&#95;t</a> cg, size&#95;t &#42; length)</>}>
Generates code for the optimized merged module into one native object file.

It will not run any IR optimizations on the merged module.

On success returns a pointer to a generated mach-o/ELF buffer and length set to the buffer size. The buffer is owned by the <a href="#ga6e1ba6da4277057a20e147d9412a03d7">lto&#95;code&#95;gen&#95;t</a> and will be freed when <a href="#ga226045782babbda624255217e4934dae">lto&#95;codegen&#95;dispose()</a> is called, or <a href="#gad07286ee88f734bf57437c9c0f7d4c6a">lto&#95;codegen&#95;compile&#95;optimized()</a> is called again. On failure, returns NULL (check <a href="#gae09912101ce40de1049e5bf6355f6137">lto&#95;get&#95;error&#95;message()</a> for details).


<SectionUser title="Since">
LTO&#95;API&#95;VERSION=12
</SectionUser>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/lto-h/#l00529">529</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/lto-h">lto.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### lto&#95;codegen&#95;compile&#95;to&#95;file() {#gadfde0ad97850e1479009556404f5bc61}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>lto&#95;bool&#95;t lto&#95;codegen&#95;compile&#95;to&#95;file (<a href="#ga6e1ba6da4277057a20e147d9412a03d7">lto&#95;code&#95;gen&#95;t</a> cg, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> char &#42;&#42; name)</>}>
Generates code for all added modules into one native object file.

This calls lto&#95;codegen&#95;optimize then lto&#95;codegen&#95;compile&#95;optimized (instead of returning a generated mach-o/ELF buffer, it writes to a file).

The name of the file is written to name. Returns true on error.


<SectionUser title="Since">
LTO&#95;API&#95;VERSION=5
</SectionUser>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/lto-h/#l00506">506</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/lto-h">lto.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### lto&#95;codegen&#95;create() {#ga31b1a72b22fc9dcca1ecd28c92e3f89d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>lto&#95;code&#95;gen&#95;t lto&#95;codegen&#95;create (void)</>}>
Instantiates a code generator.

Returns NULL on error (check <a href="#gae09912101ce40de1049e5bf6355f6137">lto&#95;get&#95;error&#95;message()</a> for details).

All modules added using <em><a href="#gaca40f093d4adbb3dcc24fe7f0056684d">lto&#95;codegen&#95;add&#95;module()</a></em> must have been created in the same context as the codegen.

  prototype={<>lto&#95;code&#95;gen&#95;t lto&#95;codegen&#95;create&#95;in&#95;local&#95;context (void)</>}>
Instantiate a code generator in its own context.

Instantiates a code generator in its own context. Modules added via <em><a href="#gaca40f093d4adbb3dcc24fe7f0056684d">lto&#95;codegen&#95;add&#95;module()</a></em> must have all been created in the same context, using <em><a href="#ga05d6a2cd667124de281532624ea6ba8c">lto&#95;module&#95;create&#95;in&#95;codegen&#95;context()</a></em>.

### lto&#95;codegen&#95;debug&#95;options() {#ga05ff9b7bf60f4b42ce3f54dd10f12d11}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void lto&#95;codegen&#95;debug&#95;options (<a href="#ga6e1ba6da4277057a20e147d9412a03d7">lto&#95;code&#95;gen&#95;t</a> cg, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> char &#42;)</>}>
Sets options to help debug codegen bugs.

Since parsing shud only happen once, only one of lto&#95;codegen&#95;debug&#95;options or lto&#95;set&#95;debug&#95;options should be called.

This function takes one or more options separated by spaces. Warning: passing file paths through this function may confuse the argument parser if the paths contain spaces.

</SectionUser>

### lto&#95;module&#95;create&#95;from&#95;fd() {#ga584067ea7910e54e01147d01a7a9cba3}

  prototype={<>lto&#95;module&#95;t lto&#95;module&#95;create&#95;from&#95;fd (int fd, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> char &#42; path, size&#95;t file_size)</>}>
Loads an object file from disk.

The seek point of fd is not preserved. Returns NULL on error (check <a href="#gae09912101ce40de1049e5bf6355f6137">lto&#95;get&#95;error&#95;message()</a> for details).

### lto&#95;module&#95;create&#95;in&#95;codegen&#95;context() {#ga05d6a2cd667124de281532624ea6ba8c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>lto&#95;module&#95;t lto&#95;module&#95;create&#95;in&#95;codegen&#95;context (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> void &#42; mem, size&#95;t length, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> char &#42; path, <a href="#ga6e1ba6da4277057a20e147d9412a03d7">lto&#95;code&#95;gen&#95;t</a> cg)</>}>
Loads an object file in the codegen context.

Loads an object file into the same context as <code>cg</code>. The module is safe to add using <em><a href="#gaca40f093d4adbb3dcc24fe7f0056684d">lto&#95;codegen&#95;add&#95;module()</a></em>.

Returns NULL on error (check <a href="#gae09912101ce40de1049e5bf6355f6137">lto&#95;get&#95;error&#95;message()</a> for details).


<SectionUser title="Since">
LTO&#95;API&#95;VERSION=11
</SectionUser>

### lto&#95;module&#95;create&#95;in&#95;local&#95;context() {#ga1da5dff4e86f96d4521f8a4aebe079e7}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>lto&#95;module&#95;t lto&#95;module&#95;create&#95;in&#95;local&#95;context (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> void &#42; mem, size&#95;t length, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> char &#42; path)</>}>
Loads an object file in its own context.

Loads an object file in its own LLVMContext. This function call is thread-safe. However, modules created this way should not be merged into an <a href="#ga6e1ba6da4277057a20e147d9412a03d7">lto&#95;code&#95;gen&#95;t</a> using <em><a href="#gaca40f093d4adbb3dcc24fe7f0056684d">lto&#95;codegen&#95;add&#95;module()</a></em>.

Returns NULL on error (check <a href="#gae09912101ce40de1049e5bf6355f6137">lto&#95;get&#95;error&#95;message()</a> for details).


<SectionUser title="Since">
LTO&#95;API&#95;VERSION=11
</SectionUser>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/lto-h/#l00204">204</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/lto-h">lto.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### lto&#95;module&#95;dispose() {#gafea8ec5886536824e8b654a113601917}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void lto&#95;module&#95;dispose (<a href="#ga3ce415fd9e8109d4835461c6de1b9d82">lto&#95;module&#95;t</a> mod)</>}>
Frees all memory internally allocated by the module.

Upon return the <a href="#ga3ce415fd9e8109d4835461c6de1b9d82">lto&#95;module&#95;t</a> is no longer valid.

### lto&#95;module&#95;get&#95;linkeropts() {#ga5bab2de970d06f8fa7b4c56f8e384161}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>const char &#42; lto&#95;module&#95;get&#95;linkeropts (<a href="#ga3ce415fd9e8109d4835461c6de1b9d82">lto&#95;module&#95;t</a> mod)</>}>
Returns the module&#39;s linker options.

The linker options may consist of multiple flags. It is the linker&#39;s responsibility to split the flags using a platform-specific mechanism.

### lto&#95;module&#95;get&#95;macho&#95;cputype() {#ga16718eb3a64b14d3fc6ebdaf119e5875}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>lto&#95;bool&#95;t lto&#95;module&#95;get&#95;macho&#95;cputype (<a href="#ga3ce415fd9e8109d4835461c6de1b9d82">lto&#95;module&#95;t</a> mod, unsigned int &#42; out_cputype, unsigned int &#42; out_cpusubtype)</>}>
If targeting mach-o on darwin, this function gets the CPU type and subtype that will end up being encoded in the mach-o header.

These are the values that can be found in mach/machine.h.

<code>out&#95;cputype</code> and <code>out&#95;cpusubtype</code> must be non-NULL.

Returns true on error (check <a href="#gae09912101ce40de1049e5bf6355f6137">lto&#95;get&#95;error&#95;message()</a> for details).


<SectionUser title="Since">
LTO&#95;API&#95;VERSION=27
</SectionUser>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/lto-h/#l00311">311</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/lto-h">lto.h</a>.

### lto&#95;module&#95;has&#95;ctor&#95;dtor() {#ga5b59ee17299706db881f30ad4ea8e1ee}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>lto&#95;bool&#95;t lto&#95;module&#95;has&#95;ctor&#95;dtor (<a href="#ga3ce415fd9e8109d4835461c6de1b9d82">lto&#95;module&#95;t</a> mod)</>}>
This function can be used by the linker to check if a given module has any constructor or destructor functions.

Returns true if the module has either the @llvm.global&#95;ctors or the @llvm.global&#95;dtors symbol. Otherwise returns false.

### lto&#95;set&#95;debug&#95;options() {#ga1e1f6473e0c498f3562c655355e45374}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void lto&#95;set&#95;debug&#95;options (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> char &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> &#42; options, int number)</>}>
Parses options immediately, making them available as early as possible.

For example during executing codegen::InitTargetOptionsFromCodeGenFlags. Since parsing shud only happen once, only one of lto&#95;codegen&#95;debug&#95;options or lto&#95;set&#95;debug&#95;options should be called.

This function takes one or more options separated by spaces. Warning: passing file paths through this function may confuse the argument parser if the paths contain spaces.


<SectionUser title="Since">
LTO&#95;API&#95;VERSION=28
</SectionUser>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/lto-h/#l00551">551</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/lto-h">lto.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
